item.title: 1:54 pm, January 6, 2026
item.description:
Okay HobbyPals, let’s see if I can top last year’s record of one (1) completed mini. I’m semi-confident I may be able to match that same pace again in 2026 if the knees hold out.

Not a great start tbf - even with my red-green deficiency I can tell that the yellow-red and black-purple here are nails-on-blackboard clashing. Maybe I can do an oil filter when I see how bad the rest of my colour choices turn out to be?

item.title: 9:15 pm, January 6, 2026
item.description:
… just now learning that the performance was a last-minute booking for a song that she had just finished writing and wasn’t even on her current album at the time.

I think it may be too dense a reference to use in mere human language.

item.title: 9:18 pm, January 6, 2026
item.description: … she had never been on TV before.

item.title: 1:14 pm, January 4, 2026
item.description:
Finally getting around to Better Call Saul and… ah, yep.

Without spoilers: there’s a short sequence in the season I’m currently watching which follows a person finding an unknown device, testing it, determining its purpose, and then repurposing the device—simultaneously resolving and opening up plotlines; developing character—all done not just without any explanatory dialogue, but without any dialogue whatsoever, and it is both clear and cinematic.

(You all already knew, of course)

item.title: 9:06 am, January 2, 2026
item.description: Woke up to hail, falling directly down onto the roof on a windless day, sounding like the house was wandering aound somewhere underwater. Now settled into the silence of an actual snow.

item.title: 9:55 pm, January 2, 2026
item.description: If I was ever kidnapped (by street toughs) and forced to construct my own ‘Darmok and Jalad’-style allegorical language, ‘KT Tunstall On Jools That One Time’ would probably be a lynchpin.

item.title: 12:13 pm, January 1, 2026
item.description:
I bought a Switch 2 in the middle of 2025 (my previous games console was, and I keep having to double-check this, the original NES), and finally picked up No Man’s Sky, a mere decade after it launched, looking for a chill space-themed exploration sandbox.

Every time I dip into this thing it accidentally generates cover art for never-written sci-fi novels that teenage me would have devoured.

Must try to dust-off the writing pen in the new year.

item.title: 3:28 pm, December 24, 2025
item.description:
The Die Hards (of which they sadly only ever made two) are now playing, it’s officially Christmas Eve.

Now I Have A Machine Gun, everyone. Feet Smaller Than My Sister, to you and yours.

item.title: 3:40 pm, December 24, 2025
item.description: Al Leong is, of course, the real hero here.

item.title: 7:18 pm, December 20, 2025
item.description: Getting the train home from a stop I haven’t used since I worked nearby years ago.The odd interaction between the ghost of a place and its literal decay.

item.title: 7:23 pm, December 20, 2025
item.description: Old graffiti, fresh fast food wrappers, a single lost glove.

item.title: 12:20 pm, December 19, 2025
item.description: It’s only noon and I’ve almost eaten an entire 200g Lindt chocolate teddy. Tis the season!

item.title: 10:11 am, December 17, 2025
item.description: Unexpectedly, my first seasonal earworm is the stone cold classic Dylan cover of Must Be Santa.

item.title: 8:36 am, December 16, 2025
item.description: Ahh, and they’ve started. Those little pre-shocks of squee realising that this is the last week of work for the year.

item.title: 3:43 pm, December 9, 2025
item.description: Opening Mastodon for the first time in a couple of days specifically for the bin chat scene. Stormy weather isn’t the same without updates.

item.title: 3:47 pm, December 9, 2025
item.description: Blue bin just tried a runner to the neighbours’ house. A firm disciplinary stance was taken.

item.title: 7:32 pm, November 27, 2025
item.description:
So while my yellows were mainly just reds, it turns out my reds need a suspicious amount of yellow and blue.

My genuine colourblindness cannot possibly be at fault.

item.title: 8:18 am, November 23, 2025
item.description: Interesting start to the day: waking from an unremembered dream muttering ‘there is no history’ to myself.

item.title: 6:58 pm, November 17, 2025
item.description: Reminded today of the sheer power of the expression, ‘he’d give you the shits’. An old favourite of my mum’s. You don’t need it often, but it’s a fine one to have in your pocket.

item.title: 7:41 pm, November 16, 2025
item.description: Forget the Die-Hard-is-a-Christmas-movie thing, I’m starting the season with the original Ghostbusters(es) and will hear no complaints.
